clinical_study.brief_title: Prediction of Postpartum Hemorrhage With Uterine Artery Doppler Measurement
clinical_study.official_title: The Role of Uterine Artery Doppler Measurement to Predict the Amount of Postpartum Hemorrhage in Low Risk Term Pregnancy

lead_sponsor.agency: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital

clinical_study.source: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to evaluate the uterine artery doppler just before labour in term low risk pregnancies. And to investigate with this measurement if investigators could foreseen the amount of postpartum hemorrhage looking at decreased in the hematocrit values.

primary_outcome.measure: To measure the uterine artery Pulsatility index in term pregnant women
primary_outcome.description: With ultrasonography uterine artery doppler Pulsatility index (cm/s) will be measure

primary_outcome.measure: To measure the uterine artery Resistant index (cm/s) in term pregnant women
primary_outcome.description: With ultrasonography uterine artery doppler Resistant index will be measure

primary_outcome.measure: To measure the uterine artery mean systolic/diastolic volume (cm/s) in term pregnant women
primary_outcome.description: With ultrasonography Uterine artery doppler Mean systolic/diastolic volume (cm/s) ) will be measure

study_pop.textblock: The pregnant women that is term and have no risk factors for postpartum hemorrhage

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- singleton term pregnancies
Exclusion Criteria:the pregnant women who have
- polyhydramnios
- Large for gestational age fetuses
- multiple pregnancies
- preterm labour
- chorioamnionitis
- history of atonia or postpartum hemorrhage

reference.citation: Kaplanoglu M, Karateke A, Un B, Gunsoy L, Baloglu A. Evaluation of uterine artery recanalization and doppler parameters after bilateral uterine artery ligation in women with postpartum hemorrhage. Int J Clin Exp Med. 2015 May 15;8(5):7823-9. eCollection 2015.
